text:
Riverside Park: A view south from West 82nd Street, showing the southerly portion of this marginal park between Riverside (left) and the North (Hudson) River in a state of metamorphosis. This work is being conducted under the joint auspices of the Department of Parks and the New York Central Railroad in what is better known as the West Side Improvement Project. The unsightly railroad tracks are being enclosed in a concrete viaduct; the top of which will carry automotive traffic. A brochure including this photograph was published by the Park Department on October 12, 1937 for the ceremonies attending the opening.

November 1936.

Gift of Department of Parks.
title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 82nd Street (West).

text:
Riverside Park: A view south from West 82nd Street, showing the southerly portion of this marginal park between Riverside Drive (left) and the North (Hudson) River, showing the radical changes effected in this area by the West Side Improvement Project under the joint auspices of the Department of Parks and the New York Central Railroad. This photograph was included in a brochure published by the Department of Parks and issued for the opening ceremonies on October 12, 1937.

September 1937.

Samuel H. Gottscho.
Gift of Department of Parks.
title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 82nd Street (West).

text:
Riverside Park: The childrens playground at 82nd Street on marginal lands after completion of the West Side Improvement Project. This photograph appeared in a publication issued on October 12, 1937.

1937.

Samuel H. Gottscho.
Gift of Department of Parks.
title: Manhattan: Riverside Park - 82nd Street (West).
